value.description: A body part has been severed, shot off or extracted, and is now missing.
An injury caused by contact with excessive heat or electricity, blistering skin and causing intense pain.
An injury caused by contact with caustic chemicals, causing skin to dry out and rupture. Intensely painful.
A wound caused by blunt force.
A bone fracture caused by the weight of severe blunt force.
An incision in the skin caused by something sharp. Large cuts can cause large amounts of bleeding.
A cut made during surgery thanks to the skills of an incompetent surgeon. Consider increasing the surgery room's cleanliness, using higher quality medicine, or just getting a better doctor.
A neat cut made during an execution.
An area of damage on the skin that may also be cutting into the tissues and muscles nestled beneath.
A wound caused by a creature piercing into flesh with it's teeth. Depending on the creature, even minor bites can turn into infections if not attended to effectively.
A deep cavernous wound usually caused by something very sharp being thrust into the flesh.
A deep craterous wound characterized by the shards of hot shrapnel embedded in the surrounding tissue.
A part of the body has been damaged by a sharp object or shrapnel.
A wound characterized by a darkened knot of tissue and damaged blood vessels welling up after blunt force.
Frozen tissue caused by exposure to cold without adequate protection.\nFrostbite is very painful, and frostbitten body parts are often lost. Common on extremities like fingers and noses.
